intro: Uvaria zenkeri, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous bark and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by spherical, fleshy fruits that turn yellow when mature. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
